algorithm_technique: Calculate angles using atan2, sort, duplicate for circularity, use sliding window.
problem_summary_simple: Find the maximum number of points visible within a given angular field of view from a fixed location.
problem_summary_technical: Calculate angles to points, sort them, and use a sliding window on a doubled angle list to find the maximum coverage.
key_insights: Points at the same location as the observer are always visible.
Using atan2 converts Cartesian coordinates to polar angles.
Doubling the sorted angle list handles the circular nature of the view.
